entry.title: SAP BTP Hackathon at SAPHILA 2025: Celebrating the Winners and Innovation in Action
entry.content:
A few months ago, we shared our excitement about the launch of the first-ever SAP BTP Hackathon in Africa in joined collaboration of AFSUG and SAP, highlighting the unique opportunity it offered for AFSUG members to bring their creativity and problem-solving skills to the forefront of the SAP community. Now, with the event behind us, it’s time to reflect on what unfolded and celebrate the teams and ideas that made this inaugural Hackathon truly special.

From Ideation to Demo Jam: A Journey of Collaboration

As outlined in the previous blog, the hackathon was more than just a competition, it was a journey. Eighteen teams, representing a broad cross-section of AFSUG members, embarked on an eight-week sprint, supported by SAP BTP experts and coaches. The focus was on building real-world solutions using SAP BTP components like SAP Build, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP Integration Suite and ABAP Cloud amongst other SAP BTP based Services & Solutions.

After intensive enablement and development sessions, three teams emerged as finalists and were invited to present their solutions live at SAPHILA 2025’s Demo Jam. The energy in the room was palpable as each team showcased how SAP BTP could be harnessed to solve pressing business challenges.

And the Winner Is… PwC South Africa!

In a closely contested finale, the SAPHILA audience voted PwC South Africa as the overall winner for their AI-driven legal services platform “Legal Ease”. This solution stood out for its innovative use of AI to simplify legal document processing and understanding, a pain point for many businesses and consumers alike. “Legal Ease” enables users to scan and summarize complex contracts, ask questions in natural language, and receive clear, actionable insights. The platform even supports translation into local languages and integrates with knowledge bases for related services.

What impressed both the jury and the audience was not just the technical sophistication, but the clear business value: “Legal Ease” addresses real frustrations around contract transparency, billing and accessibility, with the potential to transform how legal services are delivered in Africa and beyond.

Honouring the Finalists: Debswana Diamond Company and Bell Equipment

Let’s not forget the other two finalists, who also delivered outstanding solutions:

  • Debswana Diamond Company tackled overtime management with an AI-powered assistant that streamlines scheduling, reduces costs and supports employee well-being.
  • Bell Equipment automated shipment tracking and document processing, helping to prevent stock shortages and improve logistics efficiency.

Both teams demonstrated the breadth of innovation possible with SAP BTP and set a high bar for future Hackathons.

Reflections and What’s Next

The Hackathon’s main objective was to foster deep collaboration between SAP and its customers, giving local teams a hands-on opportunity to explore and build with SAP BTP. The quality and diversity of solutions, especially the creative use of AI and automation, highlight the immense potential within the African SAP community.

Amanda Gibbs, CEO of AFSUG, summed it up perfectly:

“It is inspiring to witness what can be achieved in just eight weeks using SAP BTP;

we’ve seen incredible progress and innovation.”

Join the Conversation

Congratulations again to all teams who participated and especially to PwC South Africa for their winning solution! If you were inspired by the SAP BTP Hackathon or have thoughts on how SAP BTP can drive innovation in your organization, I’d love to hear from you in the comments.

And if you missed out this year, keep an eye out for future SAP BTP Hackathons - this is just the beginning!

entry.title: AI-Assisted Calculations in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
We’re thrilled to announce the arrival of AI-Assisted Calculations in SAP Analytics Cloud—a transformative new feature designed to enhance your interaction with data. As part of our broader "AI First" strategy, this innovation harnesses generative AI to revolutionize how you create and comprehend complex calculations within the Calculation Dialog in SAP Analytics Cloud’s Data Analyzer, streamlining your data workflows and boosting analytical efficiency.

What Is It? 

AI-Assisted Calculations consists of two key functionalities within the calculation dialog: Generate and Explain. The Generate functionality simplifies the process of creating calculations by allowing you to use natural language to create a new calculation. The Explain functionality helps you understand existing calculations by providing a clear, natural language explanation. 

Key Benefits 

  1. Accelerate Calculation Creation: Instantly generate complex formulas using natural language queries, significantly reducing the time required for creating calculations and speeding up your workflow. 
  2. Simplify Calculation Understanding: Use the "Explain" feature to translate existing formulas into simple, easy-to-understand language, facilitating quick comprehension of complex calculations from colleagues or your own work. 
  3. Enhance User Experience: Leverage AI to simplify formula creation and explanation, making data analysis more intuitive and user-friendly, with future enhancements to resolve formula errors efficiently. 

How It Works

Generating a Calculation

The Generate functionality is a game-changer, allowing users to create complex calculations by simply describing what they need, rather than manually constructing formulas.

  1. In the Create Calculation or Edit Calculation dialog, open AI-Assisted Calculations. 
  2. In the formula requirement field, type your request using natural language. For example: "Calculate the Gross Margin Ratio" or "I need a formula to flag percentage values that deviate from the budget by more than 6%." 

  3. Click Generate. The AI will display a generated formula that you can review. 

  4. Once you're satisfied with the result, click Copy to Formula to use it in your calculation. 

Tip: For optimal accuracy in your calculations, provide clear and detailed requirements. Specify the exact dimensions and measures, and identify the specific members you are referring to. This precision will enhance the reliability of the generated calculations. 

Explaining a Calculation

The Explain functionality is perfect for understanding complex formulas created by others or refreshing your memory on your own work. 

  1. In the Edit Calculation dialog, the formula will appear in both the editor and the AI-Assisted Calculations tab. 
  2. Click Explain in the AI-Assisted Calculations. 
  3. The assistant will provide a clear, natural-language explanation of what the formula does. 

 This is especially helpful for understanding the business purpose behind a calculation and can be used to write a better description for the calculation itself, or just to understand it. 

Prerequisites 

This feature is part of the broader AI-Assisted Features suite in SAC and requires: 

  • A valid SAC license (BI or Planning) 
  • You must have purchased the SAP AI Units license. Please read the SAP Business AI catalog for more information, including factors for converting usage into SAP AI Units 
  • You must have the Execute permission for the Generative AI privilege. 

You can check that you have met all the necessary prerequisites, including activating the feature, as detailed here. . 

Looking Forward

This functionality will soon be available in the calculation editor within Story in SAP Analytics Cloud through the new Calculation Dialog. It holds immense potential for broader SAC implementations, especially where automated calculation creation is needed. We are committed to enhancing user workflows through continuous improvements and welcome your feedback and collaboration as part of our AI First strategy for SAC.

Thank you for your interest in AI-Assisted Calculations. We hope this new capability enhances your data analytics experience and invite your insights and feedback.

entry.title: Optimizing Data Movement in SAP Datasphere: Replication Flow or Remote Table Replication?
entry.content:
Choosing the Right Data Replication Strategy in SAP Datasphere: Replication Flow or Remote Table Replication?

When moving data into SAP Datasphere, you’ll often choose between Replication Flow and Remote Table Replication.

On the surface, they seem similar, but their operational behavior, use cases, and system impact differ significantly.

This blog uses a scenario-driven approach to help you decide which option is best for your needs. We'll also cover recent updates, such as the Delta Only mode for Replication Flows and Create Statistics for Remote Tables.

 

1. How Do They Connect to Your Source Systems?

  • Replication Flow leverages the SAP Cloud Connector to establish a secure tunnel for connecting to on-premise ABAP-based systems. 

  • Remote Table Replication uses the Data Provisioning (DP) Agent to create a bridge between SAP Datasphere and various on-premise data sources.

2. How Many Objects Can You Move at Once?

  • Replication Flow can move multiple objects (e.g., several CDS Views) within a single flow.

  • Remote Table Replication is limited to one object (a single table or CDS View) per replication process.

3. Where Does the Data Go?

  • Replication Flow – SAP Datasphere or external targets.

  • Remote Table Replication – SAP Datasphere only.

4. How Often Does Data Get Loaded?

Replication Flow supports:

  • Initial Only – One-time full load.

  • Delta Only – Load only changes from the source without performing an initial load.

  • Initial + Delta – Full load followed by scheduled delta updates (intervals configurable).

Remote Table Replication supports:

  • No Replication – Query data live from the source.

  • Snapshot – One-time static copy.

  • Real-Time – Provides continuous updates. For database sources, this is achieved using database triggers, and the update frequency is system-defined.

5. Additional Capability: Create Statistics for Remote Tables

A recent enhancement allows you to create statistics for Remote Tables to better understand your dataset and optimize queries.

When selecting Create Statistics on a Remote Table, you can choose:

  1. Record Count – Returns the total number of rows in the table.

  2. Simple – Provides column-level metrics such as min, max, null count, total count, and distinct count.

  3. Histogram – Displays data distribution per column for more advanced performance tuning and analytics.

This feature is useful for both performance optimization and ensuring data quality in replicated or live-query scenarios.

6. How Do They Handle Large Data Volumes?

Partitioning improves performance for big datasets:

  • Replication Flow (SLT/CDS as Source) – Automatic partitioning, adjustable via ABAP parameters.

  • Replication Flow (ODP as Source) – Defaults to 3 partitions; can be adjusted using ODP_RMS_PARTITIONS_LOAD.

  • Database sources – Automatic and fixed.

Parallelization limits:

  • Objects per flow: A maximum of 500 replication objects can be added to a single Replication Flow.

  • Jobs per flow: By default, each Replication Flow can utilize up to 2 jobs.

  • Jobs per tenant: A maximum of 10 parallel jobs can run per SAP Datasphere tenant.

7. Technical Footprint on the Source System

  • Replication Flow – Creates subscribers in the source system.

  • Remote Table Real-Time Replication – uses database triggers. Be aware that these triggers must be removed before transports to avoid RC8 errors.

8. Decision Guide: Which Should You Choose?

Scenario Best Choice

Load multiple objects in one job

Replication Flow

Need flexible scheduling

Replication Flow

Real-time sync for a single object

Remote Table Replication

Must avoid triggers in the source

Replication Flow

Send data to external targets

Replication Flow

Limit storage in SAP Datasphere

Remote Table (No Replication)

Already have initial data and need only changes

Replication Flow (Delta Only)

9. Takeaway

Think of Replication Flow as a customizable cargo service — you decide how many shipments to send, how often, and even whether they’re full loads or just the latest updates. It’s flexible, scalable, and works well when you have multiple packages (objects) to move.

Remote Table Replication, on the other hand, is more like direct live access or a dedicated delivery route — it specializes in one shipment at a time and can either keep it live or make an exact copy for you to work with.

By understanding the connectivity, load modes, and operational footprint of each method, you can choose the one that not only delivers your data but also aligns perfectly with your project's performance and governance needs.

entry.title: SAP Activate Methodology for SAP Business Data Cloud - New Roadmap Release in SAP Roadmap Viewer
entry.content:
Have you wondered how to implement SAP Business Data Cloud? If so, great news can be found in this blog!

SAP has announced SAP Business Data Cloud as part of the event "SAP Business Unleashed" in February this year. 

“SAP Business Data Cloud unleashes the full value of enterprise data for Business AI,” said SAP CEO Christian Klein. “Every company on the planet wants to get more value out of their data and greater returns on their AI investments,” said Ali Ghodsi, Co-founder and CEO of Databricks. “By joining forces with SAP, we’re helping organizations bring together all their data — regardless of format or where it lives". 

SAP Business Data Cloud was released with controlled availability on February 13, 2025 and is has now been generally available since April. A great FAQ blog was created in March: SAP Business Data Cloud FAQ. 

We are now excited to announce that the implementation roadmap for SAP Business Data Cloud is now available in SAP Roadmap Viewer: SAP Activate Methodology for SAP Business Data Cloud.

Its content covers all SAP Activate phases of an SAP Business Data Cloud implementation project from DISCOVER to RUN:

  • Licensing model and licensing SAP Business Data Cloud.
  • How to request free discovery workshops and assessments for SAP Business Data Cloud.
  • The provisioning process for SAP Business Data Cloud and its core components.
  • Access to learning and onboarding sources.
  • How to connect the solution to its core components and data sources .
  • General project management tasks like Organizational Change Management, End-User enablement and execution and monitoring of an SAP implementation project.

What are SAP Activate Roadmaps in general? They provide:

  • A clear sequence of tasks to follow to implement a specific SAP solution
  • Helpful guidance and best practices for system provisioning
  • Links to key accelerators, tools, and resources
  • A smooth handover from request to configuration and readiness for project work.

Have a look at the existing SAP Activate roadmaps in SAP Roadmap Viewer: https://me.sap.com/roadmapviewer:

How to provide feedback: 

  1. You can provide feedback directly in road map viewer while viewing the content. Refer to blog Providing Feedback in SAP Activate road map viewer.
  2. Send us a direct email via: sapactivate@sap.com.
  3. Leave us your comments in the section below.

Thank you for reading!

Ariane

entry.title: DSP SQL Navigator – Stop copy pasting URLs!
entry.content:
I have been working with SAP Datasphere since 2019, back when it was still called SAP Data Warehouse Cloud (DWC). Obviously I have built my fair share of SQL views, and have been analyzing SQL views even more. That means a lot of jumping from one SQL view to another, which I do through copy-pasting the URL that I am currently on and changing it to the view I want to jump to. I must have copy-pasted hours on end since 2019 on a daily basis. But that is now behind me, and I will make sure you don’t have to anymore as well!

So like I wrote in the introduction, what I do to jump from one SQL view, to the view that lies beneath it is:

  • Copy the current URL
  • Copy the view name I want to jump into
  • Overwrite the last part of the URL with this view name.

I have always thought there must be a faster way to do this. With the upcoming of “vibe-coding” and tools like Cursor and Claude Code, I finally tried to make my day a lot easier, by trying to code a browser extension.

Together with Claude I wrote a Product Requirement Document (PRD) and started working on the project together with Claude Code. Within a few hours the first useful version of the browser extension could be imported into my browser, and just a few hours later I had a polished version that I am now ready to share with you!

The plugin basically automated my old workflow. When you are in a SQL view and want to jump to the SQL view underneath that one, you simply select the view you want to jump to and press your hotkey and it open a new browser tab and open up that view for you!

Want to try it out? Basically all you have to do is download the plugin browser from the Google Web Store through this link. Then you have to assign a hotkey via the settings of the plugin and it works! You can also first check the demo if you want in this Youtube movie, where I show off the process! 

I am currently still working on the feature to jump to a view that is shared from another space, and will bring a new version of the plugin as soon as possible. If you have any questions please feel free to reach out to me!

entry.title: End-to-End Business Transformation with SAP AI Tools: A Practical Example
entry.content:
About Me

Hare Krishna 🙏 I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

Introduction: Simplifying Grocery Business with AI 🥦🛒

Grocery businesses handling food items and eatables want to deliver products faster, reduce mistakes, and delight customers. SAP offers a suite of AI tools that can automate, predict, and optimize business processes. In this example, we’ll show how a large grocery chain can transform its Order-to-Cash (O2C) process—from receiving orders to delivering products and receiving payments—using SAP AI tools.

Note: O2C is the flow where a customer places an order, the company delivers the product, and receives payment.

1. Organizing Data with SAP Datasphere 🏢💾📊

Objective: Combine data from sales, inventory, shipments, and suppliers into one view.

How it works:

  • Connect SAP systems and external sources (like supply chain partners and e-commerce platforms) 🔗.

  • Transform raw data into business-friendly models for orders, deliveries, and payments 🗂️.

Benefit for growth:
A grocery chain can reduce stock-outs and overstock 📉, understand customer buying patterns 🛍️, and ensure timely deliveries 🚚. With a single source of truth, managers make faster and more informed decisions 🧠.

Analogy: Central nervous system – integrates and harmonizes all data from multiple sources.

2. Managing AI Services with SAP AI Foundation ⚙️🛠️📈

Objective: Provide infrastructure and services to deploy, monitor, and orchestrate AI models efficiently.

How it works:

  • SAP AI Foundation handles model orchestration, monitoring, logging, and deployment pipelines 🖥️.

  • Works seamlessly with AI Core, ML DI tenants, and other AI services 🔄.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can scale AI solutions reliably ⚡, ensuring smooth operations across multiple stores and warehouses 🏬 without disruptions. Managers can monitor model performance in real-time 🕵️, improving efficiency and reducing costs 💰.

Analogy: AI control center – orchestrates and monitors AI models and workflows.

3. Predicting Outcomes with SAP AI Core & ML DI Tenants 🤖📡🔮

Objective: Predict delivery delays, demand spikes, or payment issues.

How it works:

  • Build predictive models in SAP AI Core 🧩.

  • Use ML DI tenants to access pre-trained AI models or train new ones using integrated data from SAP Datasphere 🗄️.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can anticipate high-demand periods 📈, avoid perishable food wastage 🥬❌, and ensure timely replenishment 🚛. Predictive insights also help in identifying potential payment delays 💳 or customer churn 🔄, boosting revenue and trust.

Analogy: Predictive brain – builds and deploys AI models for forecasting and insights.

4. Automating Tasks with SAP Build Process Automation 🔄🤖📝

Objective: Reduce manual work and speed up processes.

How it works:

  • Automate routine O2C tasks like approving orders ✅, sending invoices 🧾, and following up on payments 📬.

  • Integrate AI predictions to trigger actions automatically ⚡.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can process orders faster ⏱️, minimize human errors ❌, and focus staff on higher-value tasks 💼. Automation ensures smoother operations and higher customer satisfaction 😃.

Analogy: Workflow robot – automates repetitive tasks and business processes.

5. Guiding Employees with SAP Joule 💡📌🧑‍💼

Objective: Provide real-time insights and recommendations.

How it works:

  • SAP Joule offers suggestions, such as which deliveries might be delayed ⏳ or which customers need follow-up 📞.

  • Employees can take immediate, informed actions 🏃‍♂️.

Benefit for growth:
Employees make smarter decisions faster ⚡, improving delivery efficiency 🚚, customer loyalty ❤️, and operational agility 🏬. Real-time guidance reduces mistakes and accelerates response times ⏱️.

Analogy: Smart advisor – gives insights in real-time.

6. Integrating Security & Identity with SAP BTP IAS/IPS 🔒🛡️🔑

Objective: Secure AI and process automation tools while ensuring correct user access.

How it works:

  • IAS manages Single Sign-On (SSO) 🔐 for employees interacting with SAP AI tools.

  • IPS ensures only authorized users are provisioned into the system 👤.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain protects sensitive customer and supplier data 🗂️, ensures compliance 📋, and safely enables access to AI tools across multiple locations 🌐.

Analogy: Security gatekeeper – ensures authorized access to AI tools & data.

7. Monitoring & Continuous Improvement with SAP Cloud ALM 📊🖥️⚡

Objective: Ensure the system works well and keeps improving.

How it works:

  • Track AI model performance and automated workflows using SAP Cloud ALM 📈.

  • Use feedback and metrics to refine AI models and automations 🔄.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can continuously improve operations 🏬, adapt to market changes 🔄, and maintain high customer satisfaction 😃. Monitoring helps spot inefficiencies before they affect operations ⚠️.

Analogy: System monitor – tracks performance & supports continuous improvement.

8. Enabling Real-Time Events with SAP Event Mesh 🌐⚡

Objective: Ensure real-time communication between systems and trigger actions instantly across the O2C process.

How it works:

  • SAP Event Mesh enables event-driven messaging, connecting orders, inventory updates, delivery notifications, and payment confirmations.

  • Works seamlessly with SAP Build Process Automation and AI predictions to trigger automated workflows immediately.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can respond instantly to order changes, prevent stockouts, and ensure customers get accurate delivery updates 🚚📲. Real-time events also help coordinate multiple stores and warehouses efficiently 🏬, improving overall operational agility.

Analogy: Real-time traffic controller – directs information instantly to where it’s needed, keeping the flow smooth.

9. Business Insights with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) 📊💡

Objective: Turn all collected data and AI predictions into actionable dashboards and reports.

How it works:

  • SAC connects to SAP Datasphere and AI Core models to provide interactive dashboards, forecasts, and KPI tracking.

  • Managers and executives can visualize order trends, inventory levels, and delivery performance in real-time.

Benefit for growth:
The grocery chain can make data-driven strategic decisions, optimize promotions, plan inventory better, and track overall performance 📈. This strengthens customer satisfaction and profitability.

Analogy: Digital dashboard – shows the full picture at a glance for informed decisions.

Architecture Diagram

     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🏢💾📊 SAP Datasphere                        │
     │  (Central Nervous System – integrates &      │
     │   harmonizes data from multiple sources)     │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  ⚙️🛠️📈 SAP AI Foundation                     │
     │  (AI Control Center – orchestrates & monitors│
     │   AI models and workflows)                   │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🤖📡🔮 SAP AI Core & ML DI                   │
     │  (Predictive Brain – builds & deploys AI     │
     │   models for forecasting & insights)         │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🔄🤖📝 SAP Build Process Automation          │
     │  (Workflow Robot – automates repetitive tasks│
     │   and business processes)                    │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  💡📌🧑‍💼 SAP Joule                             │
     │  (Smart Advisor – provides real-time insights│
     │   and recommendations to employees)          │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🔒🛡️🔑 SAP BTP IAS / IPS                     │
     │  (Security Gatekeeper – ensures authorized   │
     │   access to AI tools & data)                 │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  📊🖥️⚡ SAP Cloud ALM                          │
     │  (System Monitor – tracks performance &      │
     │   supports continuous improvement)           │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  🌐⚡ SAP Event Mesh                          │
     │  (Real-time Event Messaging – triggers       │
     │   workflows instantly)                       │
     └───────────────┬──────────────────────────────┘
                     │
                     ▼
     ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
     │  📊💡 SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)               │
     │  (Business Insights – dashboards & KPIs)     │
     └──────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Industry Example / Use Case Snapshot 🥬📦

Scenario: A grocery chain receives an online order for fresh produce, including perishable vegetables and fruits.

End-to-End Flow Using SAP Tools:

  1. Data Integration (SAP Datasphere 🏢💾)

    • The order details, inventory levels, and supplier availability are immediately centralized.

  2. Predictive Insights (SAP AI Core & ML DI 🤖)

    • AI predicts potential delivery delays due to traffic or stock shortages and estimates optimal delivery routes.

  3. Automation (SAP Build Process Automation 🔄🤖)

    • The system automatically confirms the order, checks stock, and triggers procurement if needed.

  4. Real-Time Events (SAP Event Mesh 🌐⚡)

    • Updates on stock, delivery status, and payment confirmations are shared instantly across all systems.

  5. Employee Guidance (SAP Joule 💡🧑‍💼)

    • Warehouse staff receive recommendations on packing priorities for perishable items to minimize spoilage.

  6. Analytics & Reporting (SAC 📊💡)

    • Managers monitor order fulfillment KPIs, customer satisfaction, and stock movement in dashboards.

  7. Monitoring & Continuous Improvement (Cloud ALM 📊⚡)

    • Performance metrics from this order feed into ongoing AI model tuning and process optimization.

Outcome:

  • The perishable order is delivered fresh, on time, and with minimal wastage.

  • Employees work efficiently guided by AI insights.

  • Managers gain actionable insights, helping the grocery chain increase customer satisfaction and reduce losses.

Key Takeaways ✅

  • Streamlined Operations 🏢🤖: SAP tools optimize the entire Order-to-Cash workflow.

  • Smart Decisions 💡📊: AI predictions and dashboards support faster, data-driven choices.

  • Automation & Real-Time ⚡🔄: Workflows run instantly with minimal manual effort.

  • Guided Workforce 🧑‍💼💡: Employees get actionable insights in real time.

  • Secure & Monitored 🔒📊: Access is controlled and performance continuously tracked.

  • Customer Satisfaction 🚚❤️: Faster fulfillment, fewer errors, and smarter operations boost growth.

Ask & Learn 🤔

Q1: What is Order-to-Cash (O2C)?
It’s the process of taking a customer order, delivering the product, and receiving payment.

Q2: Do I need technical skills to use these SAP AI tools?
No. Tools like SAP Joule and SAC provide simple insights and dashboards that non-technical employees can use.

Q3: How does SAP Event Mesh help in this workflow?
Event Mesh enables real-time messaging between systems, triggering automated workflows instantly for faster operations.

Q4: Can automation replace employees?
Automation handles repetitive tasks, allowing employees to focus on higher-value work and make smarter decisions with AI guidance.

Q5: How does SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) add value?
SAC converts data and AI predictions into dashboards and KPIs, enabling strategic and operational decisions.

Q6: How is data security ensured?
SAP BTP IAS/IPS manages user authentication and provisioning, ensuring only authorized access to AI tools and sensitive data.

Q7: How do I measure improvement?
SAP Cloud ALM tracks system performance, AI model effectiveness, and workflow efficiency for continuous improvement.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
The open nature of SAP Datasphere's architecture is very much like Sergio Leone's epic spaghetti Western film, "The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly" for no reason other than how some designs can be described as such.

One of Datasphere’s biggest strength is the flexibility in how quickly a new solution can be built. It is delightfully fast. From the initial replication of SAP tables to a consumption-ready Analytical model, the development time is a fraction of prior efforts. Unfortunately, this same speed when unsupervised can lead to an excessive number of objects that will clutter and ironically slow down development.

Issues with Runaway Spaces

  • Production models using Development data
  • Transports of objects between spaces break
  • Navigation and development become a chore

If you're considering SAP Datasphere as a BW replacement or if you're already kicking the tires with a pilot project, this will help (and save you months of rework).

After implementing SAP Datasphere for a couple of clients, I've encountered limitations of the common, initial setup (The Bad) and worked through the growing pains of architecture the landscape to a scalable design that accommodates multiple teams and lines of business (The Good).

The First Design – Our Initial Approach

  • 1-tenant
  • 1-space per environment

An initial design may look like this, which isn't all that bad (but there is a better approach that I will explain later).

It is simple concept to understand. The development objects are drafted in a Development space (DEV). The refined objects are imported and tested in a Quality Assurance space (QA). The approved objects are reviewed and imported into a Production space (PRD).

This approach isolates the objects based on their maturity along the development, testing, and approval process. It also helps the technical team as they explore SAP Datasphere concepts, such as graphical versus SQL views, relational vs. fact, dataflow vs replication flow, and so forth. It's a good start.

 

The First Issues

We started running into trouble, however, during promotion or "transports" of objects.

Because each space was a different database schema, we had to take care when exporting the CSN file that contained our object definition, which required manually editing the database prefix via a text editor before importing it into the next space.

We had edit access to the three spaces, so sometimes we find an object in the Quality Assurance or Production space may be referring an object from the Development space.

This issue was compounded as our team grew and required additional coordination.

  • How can we ensure business analysts do not change IT-developed objects?
  • How do we define security so that only the approved personnel can view sensitive information?
  • Is everyone following the same approach for development, testing (quality assurance), and production?

Our SAP Datasphere architecture had to adapt and service the growing IT team and the addition of new business groups. The number of mistakes increased as the teams grew. We had to find another way.

 

The Revision

The Second Design – Our Revision

  • 2-tenants (PRD and DEV/QA)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space

Our second design of the Datasphere architecture separated the initial, inbound tables into its own space.

This allowed use to refine the role of the modelers, separating the ones who were developing the master data dimensions and relational datasets apart from those who had additional access to maintain system connections and monitor data flows and tasks chains. This was an IT-centric approach because we were on boarding more data engineers to help with the workload while defining roles and responsibilities.

With the second SAP Datasphere tenant, the transport process was smoother since we no longer had to manually edit CSN files. Also, the concern about mixing Production and Development objects were gone because the objects were in different tenants.

I imagine most teams stop here and this approach works well for IT-centric organizations where the data engineers are responsible for most of the data modeling. This approach also allows the larger group of data engineers to focus on building the data models while a smaller group maintain and coordinate the data loads as not overwhelm the environment.

 

The Final Architecture

The Third Design – Our Current Architecture

  • 3-tenants (PRD, QA, and DEV)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space
  • 1 admin-space
  • n business-space

Our third design of the SAP Datasphere architecture grew out of the initial success of our reporting and data project.

The business teams were excited with their new dashboards and the speed in which our team were able to deliver new models. The demand from our business community exceeded our team's ability to deliver due to the volume of the requests. Around this time, there was a concern about data sensitivity especially around the company financial information.

The admin-space allowed use to define row-level security via Data Access Controls (DAC). Once defined, these objects can be shared to the modeling-space. Very few people on the team were granted access to maintain objects in the admin-space.

The modeling-space remains largely the same. The data engineers continued to build their initial propagation views and fact views, maintaining the relationships and semantic enrichment. What changed was the omission of analytical models.

When ready, the fact views were shared to the business-specific spaces. This allowed the business analysis to further refine the models for their specific needs, such as adding custom restrictive measures, calculations, or aggregations.

This 3-layered approach (inbound, modeling, and reporting) allowed the data engineers who are familiar with the source SAP table relationships to build a strong foundation in the modeling-space while allowing the business analysis to consume and tailor the output.

 

Next Time

If I were to build another SAP Datasphere tenant from the ground-up, I would keep the spaces to a minimum but allow the tenant to expand with the growing pains (of rearchitecting). In essence, it would be a slimmed version of the third design.

The Space Template

  • 2-tenant (minimum), 3-tenant (recommended)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space
  • 1 reporting-space

Now that SAP Datasphere (formerly Data Warehouse Cloud and recently packaged under SAP Business Data Cloud) has been released and used by customers for a several years now, I’m curious to hear how it’s been deployed. How are you organizing the Spaces (by domain, team, or lifecycle)? Who owns the metric definitions across Spaces? How do you package the Datasphere models so that the SAC teams can consume them easily?

entry.title: SAP Datasphere News in August
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere News in August

Another month with two nice new release deliveries ✨

Learn more in my short top features video in August 2025 on YouTube 📺

In addition, explore the latest updates in our community news blogs and more.

 

 

My top features in August

 

Transformation Flow: Processing in Batches

You can now break down large transformation flow datasets into batches to avoid out-of-memory (OOM) errors when using the SAP HANA runtime in Datasphere. Defining batches on transformation flows enhances the performance and reliability, while ensuring efficient data integration and processing.

You find this feature in the data integration monitor as it is part of the runtime settings under the Batches tab. Simply pick a suitable column and define the batch sizes in number or records. You can also define to use it only for a large initial load or both initial and delta loads.

➡️  More information.

 

New source and targets for Replication Flows

Microsoft OneLake as a Source for Your Replication Flow

You can now use Microsoft OneLake—which was formerly also known as Azure Data Lake Generation 2—, and the corresponding connection type to add sources to replication flows and replicate data in CSV format from the source for initial loads.

➡️  More information.

  • Cloud Storage Provider Sources
  • Microsoft OneLake Connections

 

SAP Signavio as Target for Your Replication Flows

You can now use connection type SAP Signavio and replication flows to load data from SAP source systems, such as SAP S/4HANA and others, into SAP Signavio as target system. This allows an efficient and scalable data replication into the SAP Signavio solution.

➡️  More information.

  • SAP Signavio Targets
  • SAP Signavio Connections

 

SAP Analytics Cloud, add-in for Microsoft Excel

There is a very nice feature new in SAP Analytics Cloud, which I think is super useful for many of you. With the QRC 3 release, you can transfer a table from an SAC story to Excel and further use it with the add-in. In Excel, the transferred table is based on the same data source, for example Datasphere, and has the same navigation state (dimensions, measures in rows and columns, filters, and variables). The idea is to benefit from native Excel capabilities on Datasphere data in real time. You can adjust the report, add custom functions on top of the table, and more.

➡️  More information.

 



SAP Business Data Cloud Getting Started Series

 

Starting September 10, the Getting Started Series kicks off with three modules

  • Module 1: Build an Intelligent Application Grounded in Data Products (Sep 10, 2025)
  • Module 2: Fuel AI Innovation with SAP Databricks in Business Data Cloud (Sep 24, 2025)
  • Module 3: Create and Enrich an Analytical Model with SAP Datasphere (Oct 8, 2025)

👉  Sign up today on the registration page.

➡️  Step-By-Step Guide: Getting started with the SAP Business Data Cloud Basic Trial

 

Learning Update

Our learning colleagues are currently defining a brand new course: Becoming an SAP Data Architect.

You will learn:

🔹How Data Architecture enables efficiency, innovation, and measurable business outcomes

🔹 Ways to communicate complex data concepts clearly — to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

🔹 How to identify and prioritize opportunities, build business cases, and articulate value

🔹 Techniques for designing target-state architectures aligned with SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Datasphere

🔹 Storytelling methods to overcome resistance and foster adoption of data-driven change

 

This course is the first step in a learning path:

✅  Start with the free “Becoming an SAP Data Architect” course in November 2025

✅  Continue with a free advanced course coming early 2026

🏆  Together, they prepare you for a brand-new SAP Data Architect certification in 2026

 

My favorite blogs in August

 

Use SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Estimator

There is a great blog series about the capacity estimator SAP Business Data Cloud, which of course also includes the SAP Datasphere estimator by @FernandaFroelich. Not all blogs are published yet as the series is work in progress, but already a great start:

  1. Learn How to use SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator?
  2. Explore How to edit a quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud?
  3. Use the Capacity Unit Estimator across SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Databricks. 

 

SAP Business Data Cloud rewiring of existing Datasphere and SAC tenants

My dear colleague @Ammar_Naji has updated his blog on the rewiring option for existing SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud tenants. Very informative and includes all the steps which need to be done.

➡️  UPDATE: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud Availability via SAP Business Data Cloud

 

Open Resource Directory

This is a must read for all SAP Business Data Cloud experts out there:
➡️  Why we created Open Resource Discovery

The Open Resource Discovery (ORD) is the core protocol for application / service metadata publishing and discovery within SAP Business Data Cloud. This blog written by @SimonHeimler explains the concepts behind the scenes and gives you links to resources where you find further details.

 

SAP Datasphere SQL Navigator browser plugin

SAP Mentor and active community member @kostertim has created a very useful browser plugin to be able to navigate from one SQL view to another by just highlighting the view and using a hotkey combination or browser context menu—avoiding a lot of copy-and-paste efforts. All is described in his blog ➡️  DSP SQL Navigator – Stop copy pasting URLs! And of course the YouTube video:

 

More blogs about SAP BDC and Datasphere to check out 👇

Find more information and related blog posts on the topic page for SAP Datasphere. You will find further product information on our Community with various subpages about Business Content, the SAP BW Bridge as well as content for Best Practices & Troubleshooting. Also check out the new support content for SAP Datasphere on SAP Help for troubleshooting and analysis guides, how-to guides, technical details, and more.

entry.title: SAP Learning Conferences: Ein umfassender Überblick und Highlights 2025
entry.content:
SAP Learning Conferences bieten eine hervorragende Plattform, um die neuesten SAP-Themen zu erkunden, Einblicke von Branchenexperten zu gewinnen und sich mit Fachkollegen zu vernetzen. 

Wichtige Highlights der SAP Learning Conferences 2025

Teilnehmer können durch den Besuch dieser Veranstaltungen Ihr SAP Wissen gezielt erweitern. Zusätzlich können Teilnehmer 25% auf ihre nächste SAP-Zertifizierung sparen, indem sie sich für eine SAP Learning Conference registrieren.*

Hinweis: Dies ist ein zeitlich begrenztes Angebot und ein aktueller ÜBerblick. Eine frühzeitige Anmeldung wird empfohlen, um Ihren Platz zu sichern.

SAP Security Forum / Deutsche Ausgabe

Mit zunehmenden regulatorischen Anforderungen und dem Bedarf, geschäftskritische SaaS-Plattformen abzusichern, stehen IT-Sicherheitsteams vor erheblichen Herausforderungen. Doch welche Schlüsselthemen müssen Unternehmen angehen, um die SAP-Sicherheit in der Zukunft zu gewährleisten? 

Dieses Forum bietet die Möglichkeit, Ihr Fachwissen im Bereich SAP-Sicherheit durch praxisnahe Präsentationen zu Themen wie:
• IT-Cybersicherheitstrends
• Infrastruktur- und Kommunikationssicherheit
• Identitäts- und Zugriffsmanagement
• Compliance und Datenschutz

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum: 26.–27. November 2025
• Ort: Walldorf, Deutschland

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Security Forum / German Edition hier buchen

SAP Integration Suite Forum (Deutsche Ausgabe)

Die SAP Integration Suite ist eine Integration-Platform-as-a-Service (iPaaS), die entwickelt wurde, um die Integration von On-Premise- und Cloud-basierten Prozessen, Diensten, Anwendungen, Events und Daten zu optimieren.

Bei diesem Forum werden die Teilnehmer:
• Die wichtigsten Funktionen und praktischen Anwendungsfälle der SAP Integration Suite erkunden.
• Über die nahtlose Integration von On-Premise- und Cloud-basierten Anwendungen mit SAP-Tools und vorkonfigurierten Inhalten lernen.

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum: 15.–16. Oktober 2025
• Ort: Walldorf, Deutschland

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Integration Suite Forum hier buchen 

SAP Data and Analytics Forum (Deutsche Ausgabe)

Dieses Forum bietet Einblicke in die neuesten Entwicklungen und Trends im Bereich SAP Data and Analytics. Teilnehmer können ihr Wissen durch Expertensitzungen vertiefen und von Erfolgsgeschichten der Kunden lernen. Der erste Tag des Forums ist kostenlos und virtuell, der zweite ist kostenpflichtig und hybrid.

Veranstaltungsstruktur:

Tag 1 (Kostenlos):
Erkunden Sie die neuesten Trends und Entwicklungen in Data and Analytics, einschließlich Best Practices, neuer Technologien und Anwendungen im Zusammenhang mit der SAP Business Data Cloud. Buchen Sie hier die kostenlose Veranstaltung WDVDAF

Tag 2 (Kostenpflichtig):
Nehmen Sie an Expertensitzungen teil, um Ihr Verständnis von SAP Data and Analytics zu verbessern. Tauschen Sie sich mit SAP-Experten, Trainern und anderen Teilnehmern aus. Buchen Sie hier die Veranstaltung in Walldorf ODER virtuell (WDCDAF)

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum:
o 18. November 2025 (Kostenloser virtueller erster Tag)
o 18.–19. November 2025 (Hybridformat, zweiter Tag kostenpflichtig)

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Data und Analytics Forum, 18.-19. November 2025 (2 Tage, hybride Durchführung, der zweite Tag ist kostenpflichtig)

WDEHR4 - Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel 1.1.2026 | SAP Training

Diese Veranstaltung bietet einen Überblick über die gesetzlichen Änderungen, die ab dem 1. Januar 2026 die Lohn- und Gehaltsabrechnung in Deutschland betreffen. Die Teilnehmer erfahren mehr über die Reformen, neuen Vorschriften und deren Auswirkungen auf die Abrechnungsprozesse.

Für wen ist diese Veranstaltung geeignet:
• Projektteammitglieder
• Mitarbeiter in der Lohnbuchhaltung
• Erfahrene Berater

Veranstaltungsdetails:
Teilnehmer können zwischen zwei identischen Terminen wählen:
• Präsenzveranstaltung: Donnerstag, 4. Dezember 2025, in St. Leon-Rot
• Virtuelle Veranstaltung: Dienstag, 9. Dezember 2025

Hinweis: Diese Veranstaltung ist nicht für den 25% SAP-Zertifizierungsrabatt qualifiziert.

WDEHR4 - Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel hier buchen

Zusätzliche Hinweise

• Der 25% Rabatt auf SAP-Zertifizierungen gilt nur für SAP Learning Conferences und schließt die WDEHR4-Veranstaltung aus.
• DSAG-Mitgliedschaftsrabatte sind für ausgewählte Foren verfügbar, können jedoch nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden.

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
Introduction:

In Part 1(SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 1: Introduction to Data Products) of this blog series, we explored the fundamentals of Data Products in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). In Part 2(SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 2: Extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products) we explored on how to extend SAP S/4HANA Data Products. Now, in Part 3, we dive into the practical aspect of creating custom data products for the source SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and Share it with SAP databricks.

In this article, we’ll explore a common scenario where a customer has a custom CDS entity in SAP S/4HANA and wants to harmonize its data with SAP-managed data products. We’ll demonstrate how to create a custom data product based on that custom CDS entity, for example, ZCDS_CAMPAIGN and how to delta-share with SAP databricks. 

High-level Workflow for the SAP S/4HANA, Customer Managed Data Product:

Steps to create a SAP S/4HANA Customer Managed Data Product.

1. Identify, create, or extend a CDS entity: To build a customer-managed data product in an SAP S/4HANA system, the recommended approach is to leverage CDS views/entities. In this example, we’ll create a custom CDS entity as shown below.

Note: As a best practice, customers should leverage SAP-released CDS views first, extend them where needed, and only create custom CDS views when business requirements demand it. This is fully permissible under the clean core paradigm, as business requirements ultimately take priority.

@ObjectModel.usageType.dataClass: #TRANSACTIONAL
@ObjectModel.usageType.serviceQuality: #A
@ObjectModel.usageType.sizeCategory: #XL
@ObjectModel.representativeKey: 'CampaignID'
@ObjectModel.modelingPattern:         #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION
@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION,
                                      #CDS_MODELING_DATA_SOURCE,
                                      #CDS_MODELING_ASSOCIATION_TARGET,
                                      #SQL_DATA_SOURCE,
                                      #EXTRACTION_DATA_SOURCE ]

@ObjectModel.sapObjectNodeType.name: 'CampaignID'
@EndUserText.label: 'CDS View for Campaigning Data'
@Analytics.dataCategory: #DIMENSION
@Analytics.internalName: #LOCAL
@Analytics: {
    dataExtraction: {
        enabled: true,
        delta.changeDataCapture: {
            mapping:[
                {
                    table: 'zcampaign', role: #MAIN,
                    viewElement: ['CampaignID'],
                    tableElement: ['campaign_id']
                }
            ]
        }
    }
 }

@VDM.viewType: #BASIC
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

define view entity ZCDS_campaign as select from zcampaign
{
 @EndUserText.label: 'Campaign_ID'
    key zcampaign.campaign_id as CampaignId,
    @EndUserText.label: 'Campaign_Name'
    zcampaign.campaign_name as CampaignName,
     @EndUserText.label: 'Channel'
    zcampaign.channel as Channel,
    zcampaign.type as Type,
    zcampaign.start_date as StartDate,
    zcampaign.end_date as EndDate,
    zcampaign.status as Status,
     @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'BudgetCurrency'
    zcampaign.budget as Budget,
    zcampaign.budget_currency as BudgetCurrency,
     @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'ActualSpendCurrency'
    zcampaign.actual_spend as ActualSpend,
    zcampaign.actual_spend_currency as ActualSpendCurrency,
    zcampaign.created_by as CreatedBy,
    zcampaign.created_on as CreatedOn
    
}

2. SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud or On-Premise Edition requires a Cloud Connector: Configure the Cloud Connector to enable communication between your on-premise/private cloud system and SAP Datasphere (public cloud). This setup is a prerequisite for creating an SAP S/4HANA or ABAP connection in SAP Datasphere for using the replication flow feature.

SAP Datasphere Integration with SAP S/4HANA: SAP Cloud Connector Setup Guide

3. Create a Datasphere Space of Type HANA Data Lake Files:  An administrator can create a space backed by SAP HANA Data Lake Files in the object store. File spaces are designed for cost-efficient staging, loading, and preparing large volumes of data.

For detailed instructions, refer to the help guide: Create a File Space in the Object Store.

Additional configuration is required while configuring the SAP Datasphere tenant. e.g.  Memory must be 128GB or more. Check via SAP BDC Estimator.

If you have configured correctly then you should also see the same under the SAP Datasphere, Tenant configuration. Please note this view is only available to the SAP Datasphere system owner.

SAP Datasphere object store: Storage type will be SAP HANA Data Lake Files. In our scenario we have created a space with a name Workshop: OBJECT STORE.

4. Create a SAP S/4HANA Connection in the SAP Datasphere Object Store Space, Workshop: OBJECT STORE :

4.1 Create a new connection or use the existing connection of type SAP S/4HANA on-premise or ABAP:

 

4.2 Fill in the connection configuration details as show below and important step is select the cloud connector which was setup and configured in the step 2.

4.3 Provide the connection name and description:

4.4 Validate and test the connection making sure replication flows are enabled:

You can also use or create the SAP ABAP connection type for this use case.

5. Create a Replication Flow to Load Data from CDS Entity into SAP Datasphere Object Store (HDLF):
Set up a replication flow with the source system SAP_S4H_RI4 and CDS entity ZCDS_CAMPAIGN. Define the target as a Datasphere local table ZCDS_CAMPAIGN_BRONZE. This table, serving as the Bronze layer, will store source records and structures in their original form.

5.1 Create a new replication flow

5.2 Select the Source SAP_S4H_RI4 and Container (Source Objects) ZCDS_CAMPAIGN

5.3 Select the target as connection as a SAP Datasphere

5.4 Provide the target object local table name ZCDS_CAMPAIGN_BRONZE and Deploy the replication flow.

5.5 Execute the replication flow and check the run details.

5.6 Perform the merge table activity:

5.7 Post merge table activity, data will be available to preview and Test it.

6. Bronze to Silver layer medallion transformation using a Transformation Flow:  In many cases, data from the Bronze layer needs to be refined into a Silver layer through transformations such as splitting, merging, adding/removing columns, joins, or unions.

In our scenario, we will split the values in the Channel column into two columns Channel, Allocated Percentage (multiple rows) and apply necessary calculations.

6.1 Create a new Transformation Flow

6.2 Define the transformation steps:

Source table:HDLFT_CAMPAIGN_BRONZE  and Target table: HDLFT_CAMPAIGN_SILVER . Python script operator for performing the transformation logic.

def transform(data):
    """
    This function body should contain all the desired transformations on incoming data of Pandas DataFrame.
    Permitted builtin functions as well as permitted NumPy and Pandas objects and functions are available inside this function.
    Permitted NumPy and Pandas objects and functions can be used with aliases 'np' and 'pd' respectively.
    Python standard libraries like 'time', 'datetime', 're', 'random', 'math', 'calendar' and 'dateutil.parser' can be used without any alias.
    This function executes in a sandbox mode. Please refer the documentation for permitted objects and functions.
    Using any restricted functions or objects would cause an internal exception and result in a run failure.
    Any code outside this function body will not be executed and inclusion of such code is discouraged.
    :param data: Pandas DataFrame
    :return: Pandas DataFrame
    """
    #####################################################
    # Provide the function body for data transformation #
    #####################################################
    rows = []

    for _, row in data.iterrows():
        channel_str = row['Channel']

        if pd.isnull(channel_str) or not str(channel_str).strip():
            continue

        entries = str(channel_str).split(';')
        channel_map = {}  # To store channel_name -> summed Decimal %

        for entry in entries:
            entry = entry.strip()
            if not entry:
                continue

            if '(' in entry and '%' in entry:
                channel_name = entry.split('(')[0].strip()
                percent_str = entry.split('(')[1].replace(')', '').replace('%', '').strip()

                try:
                    percent_val = Decimal(percent_str)
                except:
                    percent_val = Decimal('0')

                if channel_name in channel_map:
                    channel_map[channel_name] += percent_val
                else:
                    channel_map[channel_name] = percent_val

        for channel_name, total_percent in channel_map.items():
            new_row = row.copy()
            new_row['Channel'] = channel_name
            new_row['AllocatedPercentage'] = total_percent
            
            if total_percent > 0:
                new_row['ActualSpend'] = (new_row['ActualSpend'] * (total_percent/100) )
            
            rows.append(new_row)

    data = pd.DataFrame(rows)
    return data

6.3 Execute the transformation flow and test the output from the local table HDLFT_CAMPAIGN_SILVER:

Wonderful our silver layer of the data is ready and transformed as per the business requirement. Now let us create the customer managed data product and share with the SAP databricks. You can also share the local table from HANA Data Lake File space to HANA cloud DB space and build the models on top of it, e.g. Building a report that provides access to 5 years of worth where most recent 2 years are persisted on the storage type in-memory/disk while rest 3 years are persisted on the storage type file and union model is build to combine this data.

7. Creating Custom Delta Share Data Products: Create a Formations Profile with Data Product visibility option as Formations.

 

8. Context is automatically created.

 

9. After creating your Unified Customer Landscape Formations profile, you can proceed to create a Delta Share data product:

10. List the Custom Data Product, so that It will be discoverable in the SAP BDC Catalog & Marketplace:

11. Search and Discover the Data Product "Sales Campaign Gold Data" in SAP BDC Catalog & Marketplace:

 

12. Share the Data Product "Sales Campaign Gold Data"  with supported BDC target systems in our scenario it is SAP databricks: We are sharing the data product with SAP databricks workspace WS_IT.

Note: SAP databricks is part of our SAP BDC formation, hence it is available under the target system options.

13. Validate the sharing is enabled and correct target system: 

14. Validate the Delta-Shared Sales Campaign Gold Data product in SAP Databricks by checking the WS_IT workspace with verifying its presence and data preview in the Unity Catalog.

 

 

 

Summary: 

In this part of the SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) series focusing on the data products, we explored how to build a custom data product in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using a custom CDS entity (e.g., ZCDS_CAMPAIGN). We walked through setting up prerequisites like the Cloud Connector, creating a Datasphere file space, and configuring connections. Using the bronze–silver transformation approach, we replicated and refined campaign data for harmonization. Finally, we created and published a custom Delta Share data product, making it discoverable in the BDC Catalog and consumable in SAP Databricks for advanced analytics and ML scenarios.

entry.title: Kickstart Your SAP BTP Journey
entry.content:
All you need to know and where to start

You may have come across articles, presentations, interviews or discussions about SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). You heard the term quite often, but you might still be asking:  

  • What exactly is SAP BTP?
  • Why is SAP BTP important?
  • And how do I begin exploring SAP BTP’s potential?
  • How does SAP BTP fit into the clean core strategy?

You’re now at the right place.

Whether you're a decision maker looking to drive IT strategy, an IT professional building solutions, a business user focused on innovation, or part of the academic community exploring cutting-edge technologies, this post is your launchpad into the world of SAP BTP.

Curious where you fit in? Keep reading to discover the tools, learning paths, and support SAP BTP offers for every IT role: from developers and architects to students, educators, and decision makers.

No matter your background or goals, there’s a starting point tailored just for you.

 

What We’ll Cover Here

  1. What Is SAP BTP?
  2. Why SAP BTP Matters
  3. SAP BTP and clean core
  4. Try Before You Buy: Trials & Pricing Models
  5. Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?
  6. SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role
  7. Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates
  8. Start building today!

 

What is SAP BTP?

SAP BTP is an intuitive, modern development and innovation platform for both professional IT and business users. It is a unified platform that brings quickly together everything you need to build any idea or business vision to life, extending, and integrating existing business applications, whether they’re SAP or not.

With self-service data discovery, modeling, planning, and analytics for business users in a governed environment, it provides integration solutions to connect and streamline applications and processes across the entire enterprise, offering pre-built business content like built-in data products, integrations, workflows, app templates, and AI services.

Here’s what’s in the toolbox:

  • App Development & Automation: Rapidly develop applications or automate processes using low-code/no-code tools or opt for professional-code development when advanced customization and control are required
  • Data & Analytics: Turn your data into decisions with built-in analytics and planning tools.
  • Integration: Connect SAP or non-SAP systems like a pro.
  • Artificial Intelligence: Infuse AI into your workflows, apps, and decisions.
  • Platform Foundation: Secure, scalable, and ready for hybrid cloud environments.

Simply put, SAP BTP enables you to innovate and stay relevant by building on established foundations.

 

Why SAP BTP Matters?

Because digital transformation is not just a trend, it’s essential for adaptability and resilience, a.k.a. survival.

With SAP BTP, you can:

  • Automate repetitive tasks and free up time for real work.
  • Connect all of your systems, so they integrate.
  • Build custom apps tailored to your business needs and vision.
  • Use AI to make smarter decisions, faster.
  • Connect and harmonize all your data, eliminating data silos
  • Get mission-critical insights from your data without a background in data science

And the best part? You don’t have to start from scratch.
SAP BTP offers thousands of pre-built content packages, from application or automation templates to integration flows to dashboards to AI services.

 

SAP BTP and clean core

Clean core is a set of guiding principles that support continuous business transformation by designing agile, innovative and efficient ERP systems. The principles focus on building resilient business processes and extensions supported by seamless integration, efficient operations, and data quality.

Central to the clean core strategy are Side-by-side extensions, powered by SAP BTP.

Side-by-side extensions allow organizations to enhance their SAP landscapes without directly modifying the core SAP S/4HANA system: instead of embedding custom code within the core, new functionalities, integrations, and custom applications are developed and deployed independently on SAP BTP.

This approach leverages SAP BTP's robust services, including various runtime environments (like Cloud Foundry, Kyma, and the ABAP Environment), development tools (like SAP Business Application Studio and CAP), and critical integration services (like SAP Integration Suite and SAP Event Mesh). Connectivity is securely handled by tools like the SAP Cloud Connector for on-premise systems and the Destination Service, ensuring seamless data exchange via standard APIs and business events from the core.

 

Try Before You Buy: Free Trials & Flexible Pricing Models
Not ready to commit? No problem

SAP BTP offers a 90-day free trial with access to 30+ services.

You can explore, experiment, and learn at your own pace how to build, deploy, and integrate with a full suite of platform services.

Start here your free trial of SAP Business Technology Platform.

When you're ready to scale, you’ve got options:

  • Free Tier: Build small apps, pay only for what you use.
  • Pay-As-You-Go: Great for dynamic needs and innovation projects.
  • Enterprise Agreement: Predictable pricing for known use cases.

Explore all the possibilities SAP BTP unlocks. We’ve outlined the opportunities below:

 

Real Talk: What Are Others Doing with SAP BTP?

Thousands of organizations, from global enterprises to emerging startups, are already leveraging SAP BTP to transform their operations. Let their success inspire you.
They are using SAP BTP to:

  • Automate supply chains
  • Personalize customer experiences
  • Streamline HR processes
  • Build AI-powered finance tools ... and achieve much more.

With over 33,000 customers and 3,200 partners, you'll be in excellent company.

See how SAP BTP customers are achieving a measurable impact across industries and lines of business.

 

SAP BTP Essentials: Resources for Every IT Role

Here’s your go-to list of resources to get rolling, matched to your role:

Note: This table is a starting point. Resource-role mappings are suggestions. Feel free to explore beyond your role based on your needs and interests. Find below what each of the resources has to offer.

SAP Discovery Center - Learn about SAP BTP Services in detail:

  • Start your experience with Guided Missions to bring real life use-cases to life
  • Reference established architectures patterns to guide your design and implementation
  • Understand how SAP BTP’s AI capabilities are used to infuse AI features into SAP’s solution portfolio
  • Create an estimate of your services to get a first impression about the usage cost.

SAP BTP Learning - Free learning journeys tailored to your role and pace:

  • Familiarize yourself with the basic concepts of SAP BTP.
  • Get enabled.
  • Plan your implementation.
  • Prepare for your go-live.

SAP BTP Guidance Framework - Provides a central access point for architects, developers, and administrators to build and run enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP:

  • Decision Guides: Quickly identify the best technology options for your specific needs.
  • Reference Architectures: Explore solution templates to effectively design and build on BTP, understanding key concepts and capabilities.
  • Methodologies: Access guided approaches to boost your cloud technology maturity, spanning both technical and organizational aspects.
  • Technology Recommendations: Evaluate and choose the right implementation options across various technology domains.
  • DevOps Principles: Empower your development and operations teams to achieve greater efficiency.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub  - Kickstart your projects with ready-to-use Business Content available for SAP BTP:

  • Integration: Access over 4,000 pre-built objects, including integration flows, scripts, value mappings, and message mappings, to streamline your connections with SAP Integration Suite
  • Development & Automation: Accelerate your projects with approximately 650 pre-built workflows, automations, applications, templates, and actions ready for use with SAP Build
  • Analytics: Jump-start your data insights using pre-built dashboards, stories, and data models specifically designed for SAP BTP's analytics capabilities
  • Information: Explore a rich repository of resources, including APIs, events, CDS views, business objects, interfaces, adapters, process blueprints, and SAP-validated partner use cases.

SAP Community - Connect with fellow SAP BTP users, ask questions and share ideas, get help and help others.

 

Stay Ahead: Strategy, Roadmaps & Updates

SAP Release Navigator - Keep up with the latest innovations and updates across SAP BTP, track new features and plan your adoption.

Road Map Explorer - Discover SAP’s product strategies and planned innovations with this go-to interactive tool. It highlights key advancements and offers a robust planning horizon, helping you precisely detail your transformation journey.

Strategy White Paper for SAP BTP - When you are ready to get deeper, discover more with SAP’s strategy for SAP BTP.

 

Start Building today!

Start your journey today with the SAP BTP Trial or explore your first mission at the SAP Discovery Center.

Got further questions? Drop them below and let’s build something amazing, together.
